definition: sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
begging for pity and asking for help (idiom)
to bring tribute as sign of submission (idiom); to submit

sentences.english: I hope you got interested in the request.
sentences.chinese: 同时希望您眷注我的哀告。

sentences.english: Listen! Your brother's blood cries out to me from the ground.
sentences.chinese: 你兄弟的血有声音从地里向我哀告。

sentences.english: No one hears their cries—no one but God, who hears and is merciful.
sentences.chinese: 没有人能听到他们的哀告，唯独慈爱的神能听到。

sentences.english: Listen to all the voices rising from the ground today.
sentences.chinese: 且听今天从地里发出的各种哀告。

sentences.english: Can we hear the voices that cry out from the ground today?
sentences.chinese: 在今天，我们能听见从地里发出的哀告的声音吗？

sentences.english: The victims' families of the murder have appealed to the Supreme Court to have a definitive answer.
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的被害家属已经哀告最高法院作切当的复兴。

sentences.english: She probably has the highest stards of any designer in the office ensures that every project is top quality.
sentences.chinese: 她高尺度严哀告，以确保每个项目都是最高质量。

sentences.english: Some people find it difficult to other people.
sentences.chinese: 有些人觉得哀告援手很贫窭。

definition: to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
